sentence: Speaker, at a time when food prices are rising and  it is harder for families to make ends meet, we should not be cutting  food assistance programs, but that is exactly what is happening.
American businesses are going to be forced to take on some of these  higher costs for materials, to cut back on production, to try to make  ends meet, to delay investment.
Every  dollar counts to make ends meet nowadays in an era marred by ill- considered Trump-inflicted tariffs that make living in America more  expensive as prices rise.
Most  tipped workers already struggle to make ends meet.
They are now in their seventies and rely on Medicaid, SNAP, and utility  assistance to just make ends meet each month.

This weakens our manufacturing sector  and  hinders our ability to bring good jobs back to the United States, and  it will increase costs for American families who are already struggling  to make ends meet.
At a time when people have  been struggling to make ends meet, these benefits could not have come  at a better time.
Families will be forced to go uninsured  or make incredibly tough choices just to make ends meet.

After their big, ugly bill made energy more expensive for American  families already struggling to make ends meet, Republicans are  attempting to finish the job by further continuing their nonsensical  attack on clean energy.

After their  7-week paid vacation, I can't imagine anything more disconnected than  for House Republicans to come back here and make their first priority  not helping working families to make ends meet but jamming through more  favors for their billionaire buddies.
I have heard heartbreaking stories from my constituents who have no  clue how they are going to make ends meet as we enter into what should  be a merry holiday season.
While families are struggling to make ends meet, this administration  is attempting to rewrite history.
It is  truly jarring to watch House Republicans cheer and pat each other on  the back while bond markets spiral and working families are left to  worry about how they will make ends meet.
Gutting the overdraft rule is a slap in the face of the families,  again, who are already struggling to make ends meet.
Imagine a single mother trying to make ends meet.
We aren't elected to come up to Washington and get rich  while our constituents oftentimes struggle to make ends meet.

They are looking at that  check at the end of being away from their family for a few extra hours,  trying to make ends meet for their family, and they think: Gee, I have  got to give all that extra money back to the government, is it worth  being away from my family?
While millions of Americans have two or more jobs to make ends meet,  these Federal employees aren't working at all.
They are tired of a system that  protects insurers, institutions, and lobbyists while families struggle  to make ends meet.
Ohio families are working harder than ever day in and day out just to  make ends meet.
Unfortunately, we  see this year after year with Members of Congress making lucrative  stock trades while their constituents struggle to make ends meet.

This is  what has happened in this Marketplace--again, just an example--because  the way this thing is structured--and this is ironic to me because I  have always thought of Democrats as standing--at least their narrative  is that they stand up to Big Business and they stand up for the little  guy, the person out there struggling to make ends meet.
I know there are veterans in my district currently struggling to stay  healthy and make ends meet.
These factors combine to make a real difference in the lives  of hardworking Montanans who rely on these jobs to make ends meet.

Instead of incentivizing the purchase of these exotic vehicles that  undermine American manufacturing, Republicans are rightly delivering  tax relief to the working middle class who are struggling just to make  ends meet and, in this case, to afford a new car.
They  seek work elsewhere just to make ends meet.
